homes_hear_details: West Virginia has not yet launched its HOMES or HEAR rebate programs under the Inflation Reduction Act. The West Virginia Division of Energy (within the Department of Economic Development) is the designated state entity coordinating with the U.S. Department of Energy on program planning.

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For West Virginia, 80% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Kanawha County (Charleston), 80% AMI for a family of four is approximately $52,400. In Monongalia County (Morgantown), it is approximately $60,550.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For West Virginia, 150% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Kanawha County (Charleston), 150% AMI for a family of four is approximately $98,250. In Monongalia County (Morgantown), it is approximately $113,550.

net_metering: West Virginia has a net metering law for systems up to 50 kW for residential customers. Customers receive credit at the retail rate for excess generation. However, the state has considered legislation to modify net metering compensation, and rules may vary by utility service territory.

state_rebate_programs.name: Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.administrator: West Virginia Office of Economic Opportunity
state_rebate_programs.amount: Average expenditure of approximately $7,000 per home
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, heating system repair or replacement, windows, doors, health and safety improvements
state_rebate_programs.details: Federally funded program for income-qualifying households at or below 200% of federal poverty level. Administered through community action agencies across West Virginia.
